sect1.title: Backup and Restore
sect1.para: The Backup and Restore panel allows Administrators to save a copy of the configuration of their ⪚ (see ), and later restore (see ) that configuration.

sect2.title: Backup
sect2.para: Backups save a copy of your current configuration, for later restoration. Backups can be made to the ⪚'s hard drive, USB key, or to a local file as discussed in , , and respectively.

sect3.title: Backup to Hard Disk
sect3.para: The interface for performing backups to the ⪚'s hard disk is seen in .
Note that to restore from a backup, please refer to .

sect3.title: Backup to USB Key
sect3.para: The interface for performing backups to a USB key is seen in .
Error messages will result if the USB key is not present, or is not formatted correctly. Note that to restore from a backup, please refer to .

sect3.title: To Local File
sect3.para:
The To Local File Tab, as seen in , enables administrators to save a copy of their current configuration to the local machine.
The term local means the machine on which you are running the Administrative Console.

The back is a single file (with the extension .egbackup) which can be saved anywhere on the local machine. To initiate a backup, push the Backup to file.
The backup file must have the extension .egbackup, but the rest of the name does not matter. Choose file names that reflect the reason for the back such as BeforeOfficeMoveDowntown.egbackup or edgeguard_8_1_04.egbackup.

sect2.title: Restore
sect2.para: The Restore tab contains options to restore the configuration of an ⪚ from a previous backup. Restoration can be made from the ⪚'s hard drive/USB key, or from a local file as discussed in and respectively.

sect3.title: From Hard Disk and USB Key
sect3.para: To restore from Hard Disk or USB key, an Administrator must be connected directly to the ⪚ via keyboard, video and mouse. The remainder of these instructions assume that the operator is directly connected in such a manner.

When connected directly to the ⪚, all that is visible is a screen with the Metavize logo. Actions are accesses by right mouse clicking anywhere on this initial screen. Right clicking reveals a menu, and the restore functionality is located under the Advanced option. The default screen and menu selection are shown in .

As is a large image, the remainder of screen images will be trimmed for better presentation.
After selecting EdgeGuard Recovery from the Advanced menu, a confirmation screen will appear as seen in .
Select Yes to continue with the restore. The next screen offers a few options. Select Backup & Restore, after which the screen should appear as seen in .
The next screen offers the option of restoring from Local Hard Drive or USB Key. The remainder of these examples assume USB Key, although the process is similar for both techniques.
After selecting USB Key, you must insert the USB key (which contains the backed-up data, as discussed in ). Once the USB key has been inserted into the machine, click the OK button.
If you have performed backup multiple times, there are data for each backup on the USB key. The system will ask which backup you wish to restore from, as seen in .
Note that the names of each backup are the date/time which the backup was performed. After selecting the backup data, click the OK button. This starts the restore process, as seen in .

While performing the restore, the window will display many messages. These are just informational, and may be ignored.
Restore may take some time. Please be patient and do not power off the machine while restore is taking place
When complete, the system will inform the Administrator via a screen as seen in .
Administrators may exit all menus and return to the console desktop.

sect3.title: From Local File
sect3.para: The From Local File Tab, as seen in , is the reverse step of backing up to a file as discussed in .

To restore from a local file, that file must be available from the machine running the Administrative Console. To begin a restoration, push the Restore from file button. This will let the Administrator choose the file (ending in .egbackup) to restore-from. Once selected, a final confirmation screen will be presented before restore begins.
Restoring from a local file requires the system to restart. The Administrative Console will also exit.
